page.title: 08KING'S MILL
page.content: {HUNDREDS OF YEARS AGO}MANSFIELD WAS ALL TREES AND FIELDS AS IT WAS PART OF SHERWOOD FOREST.GRADUALLY,BECAUSE THE WATER IN THE RIVER WAS SO GOOD MILLS GREW UP AROUND THE RIVER AND THERE WAS ONE WHERE KING'S MILL RESEVOIR NOW IS. IT IS CALLED KING'S MILL BECAUSE WHEN IT WAS A MILL IT WAS VISITED BY THE KING,WHO WAS THEN HENRY II.HE WAS OUT HUNTING BUT BECAME LOST SO HE STAYED WITH JOHN COCKLE THE MILLER.EVEN THOUGH THE KING FOUND OUT THAT JOHN COCKLE POACHED HIS DEER, HE WAS SO GRATEFUL TO HIM FOR GIVING HIM SHELTER THAT INSTEAD OF HAVING HIM KILLED, HE KNIGHTED HIM. BECAUSE OF THE WATER AND THE FINE QUALITY OF THE WOOL FROM THE FOREST SHEEP,THE HOSIERY TRADE GREW UP ABOUT 250 YEARS AGO.TODAY THE HOSIERY MILLS ARE STILL AROUND AND THERE IS A PUB CALLED'SIR JOHN COCKLE'ON SUTTON ROAD.
